Article.Title: Topspin 360 Quick Start
Article.Para: This document will describe the basic steps required to install and configure the Topspin 360 system.

Sect1.Title: Requirements
Sect1.Para: To install the Topspin 360 into a rack, you require the following:

ItemizedList.ListItem: one management workstation, such as a PC running terminal-emulation software
two people to safely lift the unit into the rack

Sect1.Title: Topspin 360 Package Contents
Sect1.Para: You will find the following items in your Topspin shipment:

ItemizedList.ListItem: 1 console-cable kit, which includes a DB-9 M/F serial cable
1 CD-ROM containing software and user documentation

Sect1.Title: Preparing the Site
Sect1.Para: To prepare the site for the Topspin 360, perform the following steps:

OrderedList.ListItem: Read the cautionary statements in "Safety Information" on page v.
Fill the Topspin registration form out online. Go to http://www.topspin.com/support/prodreg.cfm.
Check that the rack environment provides sufficent ventilation.
Check that you have all of the items on the Requirements list. Refer to "Requirements" on page 1.

Sect1.Title: Install Topspin 360 FRUs
Sect1.Para: Install gateways and switch cards to increase the port count of your switch.

Note.Para: Whenever possible, install all FRUs before you rack your Topspin 360. You can continue to add or replace FRUs after you rack your device.

Sect1.Para: To install field replaceable units (FRUs), perform the following steps:

OrderedList.ListItem:
Install any expansion modules (Fibre Channel gateways or Ethernet gateways):
Remove any filler panels from slots that will have a card installed. Begin by filling the first gateway slot (slot 2).
Install Ethernet and/or Fibre Channel gateways, as appropriate to your Topspin system. For more information, see “Install an Ethernet or Fibre Channel Gateway‿ in the Topspin 360 Hardware Guide.

Install a additional InfiniBand switch card:
Remove the blanking panel from the slot.
Slide the IB switch card firmly into place.
Check the fan blades are free.
Tighten the screws to the on the left and right-hand sides of the IB switch card.

Sect1.Title: Rack the Topspin 360
Sect1.Para: To mount the Topspin 360 in a rack, perform the following steps:

OrderedList.ListItem: Remove the chassis, rack brackets, CD-ROM, parts bag, and documentation.

Sect1.Para: CAUTION: Don't lift the 360 chassis by the front (bezel end) and back (service end). Lift the unit by the sides to prevent damage.

OrderedList.ListItem: Place the chassis on a secure, clean surface.
Open the plastic bag that contains the mounting hardware.
Check that the rack will provide sufficient clearance for the Topspin 360.

Loosen the nuts on the sides of the rack brackets, then adjust the length of your brackets to fit your rack. Tighten the bracket screws when the brackets fit the rack. Extend the brackets to 29 inches or contract them to 24 inches.
Attach the side flanges to the sides of the chassis with the screws provided, as shown in Figure 1-1 and Figure 1-2.
